title: 111_hr2889
content:
The "Oregon Caves National Monument Boundary Adjustment Act of 2010" aims to add surrounding land to enhance resource protection and increase public recreation opportunities. The Act defines key terms such as "map," "Monument," "National Preserve," "Secretary," and "Secretary concerned." The Act defines key terms such as "map," "Monument," "National Preserve," "Secretary," and "Secretary concerned." The term "State" means the State of Oregon. The Secretary of the Interior has authority over land managed by the Bureau of Land Management. SEC. 4. DESIGNATION; LAND TRANSFER; BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve is designated, with a transfer of approximately 4,070 acres of land to be administered as part of the monument. The boundary of the Rogue River-Siskiyou National Forest will be adjusted to exclude the transferred land. Additionally, the boundary of the National Monument will be modified to exclude approximately 4 acres of land in the City of Cave Junction. The map depicting the Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve will be available for public inspection. Any reference to the Monument in US laws or records will now be considered a reference to the "Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve". SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary, through the Director of the National Park Service, administers the National Monument and Preserve according to this Act, Presidential Proclamation Number 876, and applicable laws. The Secretary must revise the fire management plan to include the National Preserve and carry out fuel management activities. Existing Forest Service contracts will be allowed to be completed, with the Secretary of Agriculture administering them. Terms and conditions of these contracts will remain in place. Liability for these contracts will be with the Forest Service. Grazing of livestock within the preserve may continue at current levels, subject to permits and regulations. SEC. 6. VOLUNTARY GRAZING LEASE OR PERMIT DONATION PROGRAM. The Secretary concerned shall accept the donation of a grazing lease or permit for specific grazing allotments and terminate the grazing permit or lease to ensure a permanent end to grazing on the land covered by the permit or lease. When a lessee or permittee donates a grazing lease or permit under this section, they waive any claim to range improvement on the associated grazing allotment. SEC. 7. HUNTING, FISHING, AND TRAPPING. The Secretary allows hunting, fishing, and trapping in the National Preserve, following federal and state laws. Exceptions can be made for public safety, preserve administration, or legal compliance. Consultation with the State agency is required, except in emergencies. The Secretary must consult with the State agency before closing any area in the National Preserve to hunting, fishing, or trapping. SEC. 8. EFFECT.

This Act does not impact the State's authority over fish and wildlife in the National Preserve.

SEC. 9. WILD AND SCENIC RIVER DESIGNATION, RIVER STYX, OREGON.

The River Styx in Oregon is designated as a scenic river under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act.

SEC. 10. WILD AND SCENIC RIVER DESIGNATION FOR STUDY. The Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to include Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve, Oregon. This includes designated segments of Cave Creek, Lake Creek, No Name Creek, and Panther Creek. Upper Cave Creek is a segment of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act in Oregon, running from the headwaters to the confluence with River Styx. SEC. 11. STUDY AND REPORT. The Secretary must complete a study of the Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve segments designated for study in subsection (a) within 3 years of funds availability and submit a report to Congress with the results.
